messages.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Curious about the birth rate, death rate, and the overall population of the United States. Please gather the following information on yearly basis from 2012-2023 (including 2012 and 2023). 

Please organize the results in one Markdown table with the following columns:
Year, Total Population(Million), Male Population(Million), Female Population(Million), Birth Rate, Death Rate
Note: both birth rate and death rate indicate the number of live births/deaths occurring during the year, per 1,000 population. 

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To solve this problem, I need to gather yearly data for the total population, male population, female population, birth rate, and death rate for the United States from 2012 to 2023. I'll start searching for this data.
</think>

<search> yearly population data us from 2012 to 2023 </search>

Search query: yearly population data us from 2012 to 2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/usa/united-states/population):
U.S. Population (1950-2025) - Macrotrends Total population for the United States in 2023 was 334,914,895, a 0.49% increase from 2022. Total population for the United States in 2022 was 333,271,411, a ...

[Doc 2](https://www.census.gov/data/tables/time-series/dec/popchange-data-text.html):
Historical Population Change Data (1910-2020) - U.S. Census Bureau Access demographic, economic and population data from the U.S. Census Bureau. Explore census data with visualizations and view tutorials.

[Doc 3](https://www.multpl.com/united-states-population/table/by-year):
US Population by Year - Multpl US Population by Year ; Jul 1, 2024, 340.11 million ; Jul 1, 2023, 336.81 million ; Jul 1, 2022, 334.02 million ; Jul 1, 2021, 332.10 million.
<search> yearly birth rate us from 2012 to 2023 </search>

Search query: yearly birth rate us from 2012 to 2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/usa/united-states/birth-rate):
U.S. Birth Rate (1950-2025) - Macrotrends U.S. birth rate for 2024 was 12.01, a 12.23% increase from 2023. · U.S. birth rate for 2023 was 10.70, a 2.73% decline from 2022. · U.S. birth rate for 2022 was ...

[Doc 2](https://www.statista.com/statistics/195943/birth-rate-in-the-united-states-since-1990/?srsltid=AfmBOoqBBFTUiggM1cxCCOg4Mf6g8OH_ZlR0EuPCyuvZfCMH0E_Xj-vi):
U.S. birth rate 2023 - Statista Over the past 30 years, the birth rate in the United States has been steadily declining, and in 2023, there were 10.7 births per 1,000 of the ...

[Doc 3](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/data-visualization/birth-to-death-ratios/natality-mortality-trends.htm):
Natality and Mortality Trends in the United States, 2000–2023 - CDC These charts describe trends in births and deaths in the United States from 2000 through the most current available year.
<search> yearly death rate us from 2012 to 2023 </search>

Search query: yearly death rate us from 2012 to 2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.macrotrends.net/global-metrics/countries/usa/united-states/death-rate):
U.S. Death Rate (1950-2025) - Macrotrends U.S. death rate for 2024 was 9.23, a 0.28% increase from 2023. · U.S. death rate for 2023 was 9.20, a 6.12% decline from 2022. · U.S. death rate for 2022 was 9.80 ...

[Doc 2](https://www.cdc.gov/nchs/fastats/deaths.htm):
Deaths and Mortality - FastStats - CDC Number of deaths: 3,090,964; Death rate: 922.9 deaths per 100,000 population. Source: National Vital Statistics System – Mortality Data (2023) via CDC WONDER.

[Doc 3](https://www.statista.com/statistics/189670/death-rates-for-all-causes-in-the-us-since-1950/?srsltid=AfmBOopA48RQcHaP6GNKF-hOlRStfqq-lQU7V_XYIFvA8AEnnzlD2KGV):
Death rates for all causes U.S. 1950-2023 - Statista Deaths by all causes in the U.S. from 1950 and 2023 (per 100,000 resident population) ; 2015, 733.1 ; 2014, 724.6 ; 2013, 731.9 ; 2012, 732.8.

Now I have enough data points to construct the table. Let's organize the data.
</think>

<search> yearly male and female population us from 2012 to 2023 </search>

Search query: yearly male and female population us from 2012 to 2023
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.statista.com/statistics/241495/us-population-by-sex/?srsltid=AfmBOorF35gm-B82IJJueQ7Iiiqh-poxavSQ_cwKf45WCOcsj4cpAUM0):
U.S. population by sex 1980-2024 - Statista U.S. population by sex 1980-2024 ... As of July 1, 2024, there were 168.34 million males and 171.77 million females living in the United States.

[Doc 2](https://usafacts.org/data/topics/people-society/population-and-demographics/our-changing-population/):
US population by year, race, age, ethnicity, & more - USAFacts The US population increased 12 out of the 12 years between year 2010 and year 2022. Its largest annual population increase was 1% between 2019 and 2020.

[Doc 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Demographics_of_the_United_States):
Demographics of the United States - Wikipedia Demographics of the United States ; 18% (2023 est.) · 0.98 male(s)/female (2023 est.) · 1.045 male(s)/female (2022).
